resources.string: Already have an account?\nLog in here!
Password has to be at least 6 characters"
Don\'t have an account?\nSign up here!

Sudoku is a number puzzle in which players insert the numbers 1 to 9 into a grid consisting of nine squares subdivided into a further nine smaller squares in such way that every number appears once in each horizontal line, vertical line and square.

The objective is to fill a 9x9 grid so that each column, each row, and each of the nine 3x3 boxes (also called blocks or regions) contains the digits from 1 to 9.\nA cell is the smallest block in the game. A row , column and region consists of 9 cells and the whole game consists of 81 cells. A region has thicker lines surrounding it. This simply makes it easier to play the game.
To play the game, there are buttons with the digits from 1 to 9. Press the number that you would like to add to the puzzle, and then the place where you want to put it.

To erase a number that has been put in the board, you can click the erase button and the number you want to erase. If there is a place on the board that you are not sure is right, you can mark it with the mark button. If you want to go back, the puzzle will be saved, so you can continue later on with the same puzzle.

Let\'s get into the rules of the game. As the picture below shows, the goal of the game is to fill all empty cells with the correct digits. In this case, we have found a place for 9 on the board. We see that it is correct because all of the other empty cells in the box can\'t have 9 in it (as shown with the green line).
In the picture below we can see that the 2 with the circle around it is misplaced. The box already has a 2 in it.
In the last picture the 8 in the red circle is misplaced, because there is another 8 in the same row (as shown with the red line).
The last and the most important rule is to enjoy the game and have fun. So go and enjoy! \n\nArnbjörg, Haraldur, Hreiðar and Þórný
